alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Haralson; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Haralson, Carroll, northeastern Heard and northwestern Coweta Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Muscadine to Mount Zion to near Carrollton to near Centralhatchee, and moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Buchanan, Villa Rica, Bremen, Temple, Tallapoosa, Mount Zion, Whitesburg, Waco, Centralhatchee, Plant Yates, Bowdon Junction, Seaton Lake, Clem, Abilene, John Tanner State Park, Lowell and Plant Wansley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
